name: Fairmont Resort - MGallery Collection

reviews.text: My son and I came here for a Monday to Friday stay and didn't manage to utilise all the facilities on offer at the Fairmont because there are simply so many.
reviews.title: This place has got everything
Grand Hotel. Many flaws.
reviews.text: I know it isn't supposed to be a challenge to see if you can put a tick against trying everything this resort has available but as far as value for money goes even using half the facilities leaves you way in front.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did manage to enjoy table tennis, a hit of squash on one of the two courts, multiple swims in both the massive indoor pool as well as the outdoor pool, (both heated although maybe not the outdoor one when we had a dip), hopped into both the indoor and outdoor spas as well as enjoying the mens sauna which you access via the men's change rooms, (same deal for the ladies).
reviews.title: Disappointing.
Disappointing for the price
reviews.text: We didn't quite get to sweat it out in the very well equipped gym or run around on one of the tennis courts, my son isn't a fan of snooker or pool so we skipped the two full sized tables in the billards room but saw others having a go.
This is an older, once grand resort complex.
reviews.title: Nice Facility, but has its issues

reviews.text: It is in need of a complete renovation, but has good bones. It is in a great location, and you can see that at one time the services and physical plant was top notch, but now it is showing its age and it more than tired in major categories. Spa and pool were immense, but they didn't have much in the way of equipment or resources remaining. Maintenance seems to be an issue.
reviews.title: Friendly Haven

reviews.text: Most of the facilities were good. Some of the rooms were recently updated and were of a good size with good amenities, with bathrooms that were adequate. Lobby area is a little tired.
reviews.title: Fantastic venue with amazing views and excellent food.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Parking for guests is totally inadequate. You must park far down a hill from the entrance, and the number of cars far exceed the spaces available. Some of the access gates to the parking area that would make this process a little easier, are perpetually locked. Also, this hotel is EXTREMELY hard to find if you are driving in by car, and the signage is almost non-existent, and what is present is contradictory.
reviews.title: Wow.

reviews.text: We stayed at the Fairmont resort for two nights in February and had a fantastic time. The hotel reception area looks great and the staff were friendly. We were able to get a good deal as we were staying midweek and the hotel was quiet. We were really pleased with our room which had been recently refurbished and looked really smart. Breakfast was fantastic with so much choice and good quality ingredients. Would definitely recommend staying here, location was great too. I would agree with previous review about parking as this was the one downside. We did always manage to get a parking spot but it was often the last one.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great place with great position. The room was of a good standard.
reviews.title: Great Place Poor Dinning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But the resort was let down by the dinning experience.
reviews.title: Fantastic stay in a wonderful mountain getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the Friday night due to the weather we would have preferred to dine in but the fine restaurant was booked out, The buffet was not open and the Embers area was packed out. This is unacceptable for a 250 plus room hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: The Saturday night there was a seafood buffet which we attended. We were disappointed with the variety of seafood supplied as it was at a level that you would get from a standard Buffet.
reviews.title: Wonderful mountains getaway

reviews.text: Being a Blue Mountains Resident, and hearing about the recent history of the Fairmont, I was keen to see what the new owners had done. I stayed 4 nights for our company annual meeting. I had a Courtyard Room and it was a really decent size. The furnishing were not new, but in good shape and contemporary and stylish. The AC was a little disappointing as it didn't really seem to do anything. This was OK as the outside temp was about 24 degrees most days, but it could be a problem on really hot days or in the middle of winter. On the whole, the rooms were good. The shower in my room however was the main let down. It could be best described as a dribble. As such it took forever to shower. I wasn't happy about this at all. I did report it but I have no idea if it was looked at or not.
reviews.title: Conference Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The dinning was good. Catering for conferences at these types of venues are notoriously bad....however, the Fairmont did a great job in the is area. It was a little hard to get a drink in the public areas after about 10 pm. There are some great facilities (library, billiards room, tennis & squash courts, outdoor pool, etc) and they all seem to be kept in great shape.
reviews.title: telling all as it happened

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The conference venue and support was great also.
reviews.title: LEURA OVERNIGHT

reviews.text: I'm glad to see this great hotel get back on its feet again and I would be happy to stay again....even though I do live down the road :-)
reviews.title: Good but not Great

description: Featuring 210 rooms, the Fairmont Resort is the perfect place for a romantic escape, a get together with a group of friends or family or a business retreat or conference. The Fairmont Resort is currently undergoing a transformation as part of its entry into Accor's MGallery collection of Unique Upscale hotels. the Fairmont Resort, Blue Mountains has awe inspiring views over the beautiful Jamison Valley & adjoining Leura Golf Course and an extensive array of leisure facilities including two restaurants, a bar lounge, indoor heated pool and outdoor pool, tennis and squash courts, table tennis, gymnasium and spa treatment facilities (by appointment).
